w:r.w:t: LO1: Identify appropriate types of elements and user interface elements, and explain their functions.
LO2: Configure a mobile application user interface using the correct methods.
PA1: Analyze business needs and select appropriate mobile application development tools.
PA2: Create a software development environment and set up libraries and components.

Begin by discussing the importance of mobile applications in today's digital world. Ask students about their favorite mobile apps and what they like about them. Highlight the role of user interface elements in improving the user experience.

Provide a brief overview of the different types of user interface elements found on a mobile device, such as buttons, sliders, and tabs. Explain their functions and when to use them. Discuss the process of adding user interface elements correctly according to requirements.

Group students into pairs and provide them with a scenario where they need to create a mobile application with specific user interface requirements. Encourage them to discuss how they would add the appropriate user interface elements based on the given situation.

Ask students to create a mock-up of the user interface for their assigned mobile application, including appropriate user interface elements and configurations. Review their work and provide constructive feedback on their choices.

Ask students to present their mock-up user interfaces to the class. Peers and the lecturer should assess whether the user interface elements are appropriate for the given situation and if they have been configured correctly.

End the lesson by discussing how the concepts learned today can be applied to real-world scenarios. Provide examples of successful mobile applications with well-designed user interfaces, and encourage students to reflect on their own experiences as users. Suggest resources for further learning, such as online tutorials or relevant articles.
